20101221231001.000|20101221231003.000|TR0|

20101221231006.000|20101221231008.000|TR0|Gibbs' reaction to all of this today, 
20101221231008.000|20101221231011.000|TR0|saying, well, we just don't want to talk

20101221231015.000|20101221231018.000|TR0|said we need to talk to our adversaries.
20101221231018.000|20101221231020.000|TR0|

20101221231022.000|20101221231025.000|TR0|communicate, particularly at a time when 
20101221231025.000|20101221231027.000|TR0|North Korea is undergoing a political 
20101221231027.000|20101221231030.000|TR0|transition, where the old leader is going

20101221232050.000|20101221232053.000|TR0|FRANCES TOWNSEND, CNN NATIONAL SECURITY 
20101221232053.000|20101221232055.000|TR0|CONTRIBUTOR:  The other thing you want to 
20101221232055.000|20101221232057.000|TR0|do is alert public health officials to be 
20101221232057.000|20101221232100.000|TR0|on the lookout for an increase, a spike in 
20101221232100.000|20101221232102.000|TR0|what may appear to be food poisoning, and 
20101221232102.000|20101221232105.000|TR0|that they ought to question and be

20101221232107.000|20101221232109.000|TR0|we can get an early warning if such an 
20101221232109.000|20101221232112.000|TR0|attack is under way and limit the amount 
20101221232112.000|20101221232114.000|TR0|of damage it can do.

20101221232247.000|20101221232250.000|TR0|BLITZER:  New numbers from this year's 
20101221232250.000|20101221232252.000|TR0|census show a growing and changing 
20101221232252.000|20101221232254.000|TR0|America.  The Census Bureau reports more 
20101221232254.000|20101221232257.000|TR0|than 308 million people are now living in 
20101221232257.000|20101221232259.000|TR0|the United States, up almost 10 percent 
20101221232259.000|20101221232302.000|TR0|from a decade ago.
20101221232302.000|20101221232304.000|TR0|
20101221232304.000|20101221232306.000|TR0|The South and the West saw the largest 
20101221232306.000|20101221232309.000|TR0|population gains, about 14 percent, while 
20101221232309.000|20101221232311.000|TR0|the Midwest and Northeast grew only at 
20101221232311.000|20101221232314.000|TR0|about 4 percent. Those numbers will have a 
20101221232314.000|20101221232316.000|TR0|potentially huge political impact as some 
20101221232316.000|20101221232318.000|TR0|states gain more House seats, while others 
20101221232318.000|20101221232321.000|TR0|lose House seats.
20101221232321.000|20101221232323.000|TR0|

20101221232326.000|20101221232328.000|TR0|the story for us.

20101221234046.000|20101221234049.000|TR0|
20101221234049.000|20101221234051.000|TR0|DANIEL ROTH, "FORTUNE" MAGAZINE:  Without 
20101221234051.000|20101221234054.000|TR0|Net neutrality, you might not be able to 
20101221234054.000|20101221234056.000|TR0|get to certain sites that you want to or 
20101221234056.000|20101221234058.000|TR0|the sites you want to get to are going to 
20101221234058.000|20101221234101.000|TR0|be blocked or really slow.
20101221234101.000|20101221234103.000|TR0|
20101221234103.000|20101221234106.000|TR0|HARLOW:  Right now, all online content is 
20101221234106.000|20101221234108.000|TR0|treated equally, no matter who the service 
20101221234108.000|20101221234110.000|TR0|provider is.  But a battle is brewing 
20101221234110.000|20101221234113.000|TR0|between those Internet service providers 
20101221234113.000|20101221234115.000|TR0|and content companies that provide things 
20101221234115.000|20101221234117.000|TR0|like online video.
20101221234117.000|20101221234120.000|TR0|

20101221234122.000|20101221234125.000|TR0|maintained by the cable and telecom 
20101221234125.000|20101221234127.000|TR0|companies.
20101221234127.000|20101221234129.000|TR0|
20101221234129.000|20101221234132.000|TR0|(voice-over) So if I'm watching an HD show 
20101221234132.000|20101221234134.000|TR0|online on a site like Hulu, that's kind of 
20101221234134.000|20101221234137.000|TR0|like driving a semi truck, but if I'm just 
20101221234137.000|20101221234139.000|TR0|sending an e-mail, well, that's more like 
20101221234139.000|20101221234141.000|TR0|a Smart Car: less wear and tear on the 
20101221234141.000|20101221234144.000|TR0|road.  So if I'm a  gas guzzler or a data 
20101221234144.000|20101221234146.000|TR0|hog, should I have to pay more?  And if I 
20101221234146.000|20101221234148.000|TR0|do, will that stifle innovation?
20101221234148.000|20101221234151.000|TR0|
20101221234151.000|20101221234153.000|TR0|BARRY DILLER, CHAIRMAN  &  CEO, IAC:  This 
20101221234153.000|20101221234156.000|TR0|is for the person who's in a garage, the 
20101221234156.000|20101221234158.000|TR0|proverbial inventor, entrepreneur in a 
20101221234158.000|20101221234200.000|TR0|garage.
20101221234200.000|20101221234203.000|TR0|
20101221234203.000|20101221234205.000|TR0|HARLOW (voice-over):  And access for the 
20101221234205.000|20101221234208.000|TR0|next big startup becomes challenged, could 
20101221234208.000|20101221234210.000|TR0|we miss out on the next Google or 
20101221234210.000|20101221234212.000|TR0|Facebook?  Barry Diller's IAC runs more 
20101221234212.000|20101221234215.000|TR0|than 50 Internet companies, and he's an 
20101221234215.000|20101221234217.000|TR0|adamant supporter of Net neutrality.
20101221234217.000|20101221234220.000|TR0|

20101221234222.000|20101221234224.000|TR0|the word entrepreneur very much.  Our

20101221234227.000|20101221234229.000|TR0|years came from essentially technology, 
20101221234229.000|20101221234231.000|TR0|and it came from the Internet.
20101221234231.000|20101221234234.000|TR0|
20101221234234.000|20101221234236.000|TR0|HARLOW (on camera):  Now it seems like 
20101221234236.000|20101221234239.000|TR0|you're saying, Barry, that the big media
